author: @thestarkenya
title: Obama, Michelle jointly address divorce claims
text:
Former US President Barack Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama have jointly addressed claims that they are divorcing following months of speculation.
Speaking on the IMO podcast, which is owned by Michelle and her elder brother Craig Robinson, Obama said he did not even know rumour mills were talking about it.
He said that he was shocked when the matter came to his attention.
‚ÄúThese are the kind of things that I just miss, I don‚Äôt even know this stuff is going on, and then somebody mentioned it to me and I was like, what are you talking about?‚Äù Obama remarked at the beginning of the podcast.
On her part, Michelle said that not even once has the thought of leaving Obama crossed her mind ever since they got married.
She noted that while they had had hard times previously, they had also had many adventures together.
The former US First Lady insisted that she has become a better person over the years because of the man she married.
‚ÄúThere hasn‚Äôt been one moment in our marriage where I thought about quitting on my man. We have had some really hard times, we have had a lot of fun times, a lot of adventures and I have become a better person because of the man I'm married to,‚Äù Michelle said.
The speculations started when the former first lady failed to accompany her husband to several high-profile events ‚Äì including Donald Trump's inauguration and the funeral of former President Jimmy Carter.
In an April 2025 appearance on the Work in Progress podcast hosted by actress Sophia Bush, Michelle said she was now in a position to control her own calendar as a "grown woman".
She said that people were not able to believe that she was making a decision for herself and instead had to assume that she was divorcing.
The former First Lady however, admitted that she felt some guilt for stepping back from certain duties.
"This year people couldn't even fathom that I was making a choice for myself that they had to assume that my husband and I are divorcing‚Ä¶ This couldn't be a grown woman just making a set of decisions for herself, right? But that's what society does to us.
"I chose to do what was best for me. Not what I had to do. Not what I thought other people wanted me to do."

author: Alexandra Frost
title: ‚ÄòSephora kids‚Äô and the concerning influence of social media on tween girls
text: Home / News ‚ÄòSephora kids‚Äô and the concerning influence of social media on tween girls It‚Äôs a far cry from their millennial parents‚Äô trips to Claire‚Äôs for cheap eyeshadow. By Alexandra Frost January 25, 2024 BlessedSelections/Getty In This Article What's the "Sephora kids" trend all about? What parents of "Sephora kids" can do For many mothers of today‚Äôs tweens, our coming-of-age looked a bit more‚Ä¶basic. At 10, we were the connoisseurs of Bonnie Bell lip gloss, Claire‚Äôs stores, Cucumber Melon-scented shower gel from Bath and Body Works and all things glitter. So today‚Äôs tweens‚Äô search for premium skincare products at high-end cosmetic stores like Sephora might seem a bit extreme. While we were fighting acne, they are navigating eight-step skincare routines with products that cost hundreds of dollars, and sharing about it on TikTok. Exactly what is the driving force behind this new ‚ÄúSephora kids‚Äù trend and how do parents navigate the phenomenon amidst social media influencers and Insta pressure? What‚Äôs the ‚ÄúSephora kids‚Äù trend all about? According to 2023 data by Greenlight, a company that works to provide resources and debit cards for raising financially-smart kids, children and teens are spending around $14.7 million at Sephora, a dollar amount that has more than doubled in the last two years. The data also shows that same group of consumers is spending $8 million at Ulta Beauty. One TikTokker laments about how every time she goes into Sephora now, she‚Äôs surrounded by ‚Äúlittle girls.‚Äù Related: Sephora employee shares wild story about tween girl fighting with her mom over a $900 haul The spending itself calls for some parenting. ‚ÄúAs we navigate this trend, there‚Äôs an opportunity for parents to weave financial literacy into conversations with their kids,‚Äù says Jennifer Seitz, Director of Education at Greenlight in Atlanta. ‚ÄúThey can teach budgeting skills, help them understand the value of money, and ensure they spend responsibly before a pattern of impulse buys or overspending becomes the norm.‚Äù @michelasheedy This is embarrassing. Go get a lip smackers üò≥üíÄ #sephorakids #sephora #makeup #drunkelephant #kids ‚ô¨ Funny ‚Äì Gold-Tiger And it‚Äôs not just the financial impact a trip to Sephora or Ulta Beauty might have for tweens. The pressure to look put together or keep up with the trends can impact young adolescents‚Äô self-esteem. ‚ÄúSocial media amplifies the youth mental health crisis by bombarding teens with unrealistic beauty standards, and AI-generated filters exacerbate the issue by leading teens to a warped sense of beauty and maturity,‚Äù says Nicholette Leanza, a Licensed Professional Clinical Counselor for LifeStance Health. ‚ÄúSocial media and the beauty industry often show idealized versions of women which influences young girls to want to look more mature and sophisticated.‚Äù @bahamasyogini 10 year old sephora haul #sephorahaul #sephorakids #drunkelephant @Drunk Elephant #summerfridays #haul #momtok #beautytok #veblen #conspicuousconsumption ‚ô¨ original sound ‚Äì your yoga mom ü§∏üèº‚ôÄÔ∏è What parents of ‚ÄúSephora kids‚Äù can do When it comes to the financial aspect of this trend, Seitz has some pointers for parents. Help your children find a balance between exploring their interests while also teaching healthy financial lessons‚Äîones that reach beyond the doors of the beauty store. Emphasize trade-off decisions by helping kids identify their wants vs. their needs. Establish guidelines on how money is spent. Educate your kids on what can happen if impulse purchases become the norm instead of the exception‚Äîfor both you and them in the future. ‚ÄúGrowing up in today‚Äôs digital world often exposes kids and teens to more pressure from peers and society at large, where the desire to fit in or keep up with trends can be overwhelming,‚Äù says Seitz. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs important to engage in thoughtful conversations with children about the influence of social media hype on their spending decisions. Encourage them to reflect on their personal values, differentiating between lasting interests and transient trends.‚Äù Leanza shares that same sentiment. ‚ÄúParents can help counteract negative social media and peer influence by praising their daughter‚Äôs character over her appearance as well as focusing more on inner growth and self-worth rather than likes and followers,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúEncouraging girls to follow more body positive influencers and celebrities can also help cultivate a healthier self-esteem and body image and help dispel some of the negative messages social media and the beauty industry projects at girls.‚Äù Related: Mom defends taking 10-year-old daughter to Sephora For Iva Pawling, president of Hello Franki, a clothing retailer for tweens, parents affected by the ‚ÄúSephora kids‚Äù trend must recognize that there are retailers they can trust that are working to meet the needs of tweens and doing so in a parent-approved fashion. ‚ÄúWe recognize there‚Äôs a gap in the market right now for tweens and we want to fill that with a fun place for a tween to call their own,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúOur goal is to really have the voice of the tween be the essence of everything we do. We want to empower tween girls to be comfortable and confident in expressing themselves as they are.‚Äù While the new trend might be overwhelming and new chartered territory for many parents, their ability to guide their daughter through it will be an important step in not only defining her spending habits but also her self-worth. ‚ÄúFor parents who are grappling with their daughter over emphasizing how she looks and being obsessed with makeup and skin care products, start by having conversations with her about what genuine and realistic beauty looks like inside and out,‚Äù reminds Leanza. ‚ÄúHelp her to understand that she‚Äôs so much more than just her appearance, and that her appearance does not define her. These are important messages for every young girl to hear and internalize.‚Äù

title: El Tren Maya suspende sus operaciones a menos de dos semanas de haberlas iniciado
text:
El Tren Maya, uno de los proyectos insignia de la administraci√≥n del presidente Andr√©s Manuel L√≥pez Obrador, anunci√≥ que suspender√≠a sus operaciones desde este jueves 28 de diciembre y hasta el pr√≥ximo 1 de enero.
Hasta hoy, solo estaba habilitado el tramo de Campeche a Canc√∫n, que comprende m√°s de 400 kil√≥metros de v√≠a. El motivo de la suspensi√≥n es que el tren se preparar√° para la preapertura del siguiente tramo , que va de Canc√∫n a Palenque.
Publicidad De acuerdo con el general David Lozano √Åguila, encargado del proyecto, la ocupaci√≥n del tren desde su apertura el pasado 15 de diciembre hasta este 27, estaba a tope, seg√∫n dijo en la inauguraci√≥n del proyecto.
Los boletos para el primer viaje al p√∫blico del tren se terminaron en tan solo 20 minutos a trav√©s de su plataforma v√≠a internet.
Para las personas que adquirieron boletos en los d√≠as en los que no se brindar√° servicio, las autoridades pusieron a disposici√≥n un correo electr√≥nico.
Si compraste boleto, por favor escr√≠benos al correo: info@ventaboletostrenmaya.com.mx
Agradecemos su comprensi√≥n.
¬°Porque todos somos Tren Maya! pic.twitter.com/U7XrF3jcQg
‚Äî Tren Maya (@TrenMayaMX) December 28, 2023 El proyecto ferroviario adem√°s de brindar un atractivo tur√≠stico para la regi√≥n, busca convertirse en una opci√≥n de transporte asequible a los locales del sureste, aunque a√∫n no se sabe cu√°ndo se contar√° con este servicio o el monto de la tarifa.
De igual forma, se pretende que √©ste ofrezca el servicio de transporte de carga, pero para ello tampoco se cuenta con una fecha. Los representantes del sector transportista en la regi√≥n han cuestionado que exista la viabilidad econ√≥mica para esta modalidad.
Con informaci√≥n de Tzuara De Luna...
